description: We are Toronto's original craft brewery tour experience. Its an engaging and interactive tour where we teach you how to taste beer like a pro. We take you to tour three different craft breweries in Toronto. You'll get 20oz of beer samples at EACH brewery. Pickup and drop off is also included. Its a super convenient way to see what Toronto's craft beer scene is all about.

reviews.title: Craft beer tour 2024
text: Great time. Our beer guide Miguel was amazing. He’s knowledgeable and fun and if you’re going to tour you need to ask for Miguel or riot. Honestly amazing dude.

reviews.title: Great beer!
text: This was such a fun experience to taste all the different locally made beers in the area. My partner and I both enjoyed this tour a lot!

reviews.title: Toronto Craft Brewery Tour
text: I had a great time on the craft brewery tour! Driver arrived right on time and took us to some great local breweries. I felt like a learned a lot about the local brew scene and just Toronto in general. Definitely recommend this tour!

reviews.title: Very much appreciated
text: Alex was very knowledgeable and formative but didn’t overload us. We got to see behind the scenes in one of the breweries which was very interesting. Would recommend to anyone that enjoys a good day out, and especially beer lovers. Thumbs up. :D

reviews.title: Fun Day Activity - Fantastic Experience
text: We went for a small bachelor party get together and Alex was an amazing tour guide and host. We had an amazing time!!! He answered any and all questions we had about the beers and brewery process and had a fantastic and energetic attitude the whole trip. He made the trip very memorable with lots of laughs. Would definitely recommend for anyone interested about the brewery process but also just looking to explore some local craft brewery options in the area.
Highly recommend!

reviews.title: Wish it were beer
text: I would’ve loved it but it was canceled due to me being the only one to schedule it. Traveling by yourself used to be the greatest and many tours were  super but lately and a little precovid this seems to happen a lot.  The tour operator tried really hard to reschedule me but we couldn’t make it work.  They did provide me with a list of breweries to visit and that makes me very happy.

reviews.title: Good tour, fun experience, a little pricey
text: Solid tour and fun experience, tour guide (Melissa) was knowledgeable about the breweries and a good guide. We went to High Park (really great), Rainhard (meh - take it or leave it, the brewery worker didn’t say more than a couple words the whole time and wasn’t engaged making the experience less enjoyable), and Junction Brewery (experience was awesome - even played road hockey with a bunch of the employees)! In hindsight the price was a little high for the experience, but we had fun nonetheless.

reviews.title: Awesome !
text: My girlfriend and I went on a tour as a birthday gift for my 30th. We had an awesome time !! We never knew there was so much to learn about beer! It was a great way to spend the night. The team did a great job, even with restrictions from Covid they still were able to make it fun and enjoyable. Would definitely go on another in the future. Thanks !

reviews.title: Fun and informative!
text: Spent a snowy Sunday afternoon touring three excellent East End breweries (Muddy York, Longslice, and Black Lab) with Reese and a van load of beer drinkers. Great variety of beers, lots of laughs, and some fresh insights into the brewing process. Reese was a great guide and host. Highly knowledgeable and welcoming. Definitely recommended!

reviews.title: A great beer tour
text: Our guide, Reece, was fun and very informative. All 3 breweries were unique and had a great variety of beers. My husband and I had an awesome time.

reviews.title: Great way to spend a Saturday afternoon in the dead of winter!
text: I just did this tour with a few friends (east end) and we had such a great time. We normally participate in RunTOBeer with Dan which is what prompted us to register for a tour with him. Everyone on the tour was friendly and each brewery provided us with some delicious refreshments. Dan is super knowledgeable on everything beer, he's a beer sommelier, and was able to answer all my questions about "what is it about this beer that I like/don't like". If you're looking for a great way to explore local craft beer at its finest, look no more and get on this tour!

reviews.title: Fun Time East Toronto Brewery Tour
text: Excellent tour. Full value for the money and experience. The guide was both knowledgeable and accommodating, without being obnoxious and elitist. The guide engaged all the attendees and made sure the tastes and preferences were considered. The guide either presented at each brewery, or had the brewery rep present and provide a tour. And we used/saved some time to visit an extra location. Thanks Matt!

reviews.title: Beer tour
text: I purchased a craft beer tour for my hubby's Christmas present. We had a blast! Gavin the beer captain was very knowledgeable and friendly and the people we met on the tour were a lot of fun. I would definitely do this again. Great tour for anyone wanting to explore new beers and having a fun night out.

reviews.title: Amazing!!
text: Our tour guide, Matthew, was fantastic and so knowledgeable. We had a great experience and would definitely recommend touring with this company.

reviews.title: Crafty brew tour in Toronto
text: Great way to spend an afternoon. We visited 3 different craft breweries, each with their own unique qualities. Great Lakes Brewery gets the nod as the leader in terms of tutored tasting, breadth of product, and hip swag. Most established of the three, so the others might have time to catch up. Henderson was really cool, and a close second. Really busy place with lots going on in their event space, but some time with the head brewmaster and guided tasting. Black Oak came in third, but bronze ain’t bad with this kind of competition. Nice tour and our TBT Gavin took the reigns on the tasting. Their sour was a standout for me.

Kudos to Gavin for driving and hosting at each of the stops and making for a fun filled, learning experience. One suggestion for those going.....eat before you go. With a noon meetup and 12:30 start at stop #1, unless you have an iron stomach and can manage on potato chips between stops, there are scant opportunities to eat along the way, and 5pm is a long time to stretch from breakfast, even a late one.

reviews.title: East end Beer Tour
text: Had a really good time! Guide was very knowledgeable. The three breweries we went too were very welcoming. Beer was excellent!

reviews.title: Very friendly and knowledgeable
text: I have never done a brewery tour before but the tour guide was friendly, very knowledgeable and highly interested in beer.  The tour was very easy to book and ran on time with no hassles.  We did a west end tour and there were no complaints, we even had some extra time and some of were able to check out a couple of extra places not on the tour.  I strongly recommend eating before and and tipping ahead of time, the tour flies by and by the end of the night you may not be thinking of tipping but rather where to get a bite to eat afterwards.

reviews.title: Excellent night out
text: Had a great tour with Matt on the 4th January 2019. Thank you Matt all your beer knowledge and the places we went. Definitely keep Shacklands on the list they are an awesome place. Cheers from Perth, Australia.

reviews.title: Great Time!!
text: Lots of fun!  Enjoyed the stories and history of the Breweries.  Our driver Jelena was fantastic and made our tour extremely enjoyable.  Learned a great deal about beer and discovered several new ones we will be enjoying from now on. The staff at the breweries we visited were very knowledgable and enthusiastic and answered all our questions. We did the West tour and would like to go back for the East tour.

reviews.title: Absolutely Worth It!!!!!
text: My friend Steve and I did the 'East 'end tour as he received it as a gift for his birthday and I tagged along.  Best decision I've mad in months lol

We were picked up on time (we were to meet at 11:45) at Woodbine subway in a van that seated 10 people (there was 8 of us on the tour so it was roomy).  Our guide was Maddie and she was awesome.  She welcomed us all and gave us a quick synopsis on where we were going and what we were going to be sampling.  She was funny, smart and took great care in making sure we were all happy.
We visited three breweries:  Left Field, Muddy York and Black Lab Brewery.

We did tasting flights (four samples per flight) at all three breweries and the hosts at all three were excellent and very welcoming.  Our whole group got along well and there's nothing like a little alcohol to rid any shyness.  In fact, four of us headed downtown to the Beer Bistro to put our new knowledge to the test after the tour lol
We did have some chips on the ride between breweries but by the end we were starving and so I'd recommend having a granola bar or protein bar in your pocket.
I would totally recommend this tour and we are already planning on doing the tour of the 'West' end breweries with them. GREAT TOUR!!!!!

reviews.title: Brewery tour
text: We had so much fun work Mike!!!! We learned so much on our tour and he was excellent. He was very informative on all the processes and what it takes to make a gold beer, and he was so fun

reviews.title: Great time!
text: Lots of fun! I bought tickets as a gift for my dad and we both had a great time. I would highly recommend

reviews.title: Great way to experience some breweries
text: I received this as a present from friends. Shortly afterwards, I needed to go on medications that limit the amount of alcohol I can consume. The owner (Steve) was very accommodating and let me have a sample per brewery + a can to take home in lieu of the the rest of the flight. Awesome tour overall, the tour guide was knowledgable and the breweries were great. The server at Left Field said their beer Gigante was named after a player "José Altuvo" which cracked me up 😂

reviews.title: Excellent
text: Very enjoyable and informative. Good choice of breweries. Matt was an excellent and knowledgeable guide.

reviews.title: Great Fun
text: Our Brew Captain, Reece, met us at our hotel. He was super punctual and we headed out for a fun afternoon! Reece is funny and engaging and really knows a lot about beer. He took our group to Great Lakes, Black Oak, and Henderson Breweries. Each place had excellent product. I would return to all three. These are places that are tough to get to without a car in Toronto, so doing this tour was well worth it. If you like beer and fun, this tour is an excellent choice!

reviews.title: Great tour!
text: We greatly enjoyed our tour with Maddie. We visited three breweries, had great samples, and enjoyed learning about the craft scene in Toronto. Traveling in the van was convenient, as were the snacks provided.

reviews.title: Toronto Beer Tour
text: Absolutely outstanding experience. Knowledgeable and friendly staff, we all had an amazing time! Thank you!

reviews.title: Awesome way to spend a Saturday afternoon
text: This craft beer tour was a lot of fun. We went to 3 very different breweries and got to taste 4 flights from each. Our tour guide was very knowledgeable and friendly and gave us a thorough explanation of the brewing process.If you are interested in beer and want to explore the city a bit, it's a win-win!

reviews.title: The Beer was delicious!
text: I received this as a Christmas present, so my friends and I recently did the West End Tour.  I was rather underwhelmed with the entire tour.  Maybe it was the timing, as we did the 6:00 PM tour on a Saturday, but it didn't really seem like a tour, as much as a beer tasting.  The first stop, the brewery owner dropped by unexpectedly so he gave us a short tour, which lasted about 10 minutes.  If he had not stopped in i expect it would not have been a tour of the floor. Then we proceeded to have four 5oz flights.  The beer was great.  The next stop there was no tour, just the four flights.  It was explained to us what we were drinking, but it was really not much more than that.  We did walk through the shop floor while going to the back room for the tasting.  The third stop was also just a sample of the beers (four 5 oz flights), and as there was a private event happening there was no tour.  Overall, I had fun but simply because I was with friends. My friends and I spent over $400 in total for the tickets, and frankly, we could have done it 100% on our own with Uber/Taxi and done it for a lot cheaper.  After all, there was not much of a tour to it and we received a little less than 4 Pints in total.

reviews.title: Very Fun Experience
text: This was our second tour. First time on the East end. On time picking us up. Having snacks available is appreciated. Talkative and knowledgeable tour guide! Breweries were great! Got to try some delicious beers! We will definitely be doing the West end again next and trying the breweries we didn’t get to see the first time around. A great gift idea for any beer lover. Fun with friends, or to make new ones! Highly recommended.

reviews.title: Great afternoon!
text: Really interesting learning about the brewing process. Our guide was amazing!  We tried several different beers, visited a few great breweries and got to meet some nice people!

reviews.title: Great Tour Guide, very informative, but cheaper ways to drink!
text: I bought tickets for my boyfriend and I to do for his birthday. We really enjoyed ourselves! Our guide Reese was very personable and knew a lot about beer and the breweries we visited. We visited three breweries and were served a flight of about 20oz total at each brewery. Although very well done, the tickets seem to be a bit overpriced seeing that on top of the roughly 60oz of beer you get over the whole tour, the only other costs to factor in are the Guide's salary, company's cut, and the ride from Broadview Station, between breweries, and back to the station. We still tipped Reese well at the end. It was a great way to learn about beer however you likely can go between breweries in Toronto and buy more beer for a cheaper price.

reviews.title: Top notch Brewery Tour experience!
text: Myself and six others had such a blast on this tour! Our Brew Captain, Reece was incredibly knowledgeable about breweries, the brewing process, and different types of craft beers.  He went over and above two ensure we had fun and had the chance to taste a selection of excellent beverages from some amazing local breweries.  Reece answered any questions we had along the way and kept us on track throughout the tour.  We will definitely be back to try out the East Tour!

reviews.title: Amazing experience!
text: I loved this brewery tour! Our guide, Reese, was very charming and knew a lot about the craft beer making process. I would absolutely do this again!

reviews.title: Lots of fun with great takeaways
text: Reece was very well organized, fun and extremely knowledgeable when it came to the science of beer.  The brewery selections were spot on and and the beer was excellent.  I definitely know more about beer now than I did before the tour!

reviews.title: Well organized and very knowledgeable guide
text: We got Toronto Brewery Tour tickets as a Christmas gift, and it was a great idea! Our beer guide, Reece, was very knowledgeable and you could tell passionate about the brewing process. We learned how beer was made and about the different craft breweries in Toronto. Reece drove us to 3 different craft breweries around the east side of Toronto. We will absolutely be doing the Toronto Brewery Tours again and hope Reece will be our guide again!

reviews.title: Great tour with great beers
text: Took the tour in early November, very good tour with a great selections of beers from different breweries, for those doing the west end tour, Henderson’s is very good. Very informative tour with a great guide. Would highly recommend for those looking to explore Toronto’s craft beer scene.

reviews.title: Great East End Brewery Tour
text: I booked this tour for my husband's birthday. We went with 7 friends to tour 3 east end breweries. The entire experience was fantastic. We got flights at each brewery, Reese was incredibly knowledgeable and friendly, and everything was well organized.
One of my friends is terrified of dogs, and Reese went out of his way to ensure dogs stayed away from her at Black Lab.
Overall, was a great time!
Thanks!

reviews.title: Great evening with Toronto Brewery Tours
text: Our tour with Toronto Brewery Tours was fantastic! Our tour captain Mike was on time for the appointed meeting place. He greeted us warmly and was very personable throughout the tour. We never felt that we were rushed at each brewery (3 breweries) and was very patient and informative with our questions throughout the tour. We had 1 person on our tour who was a non beer drinker and Mike made it his mission to find a beer that she liked and he succeeded. Each brewery that we visited had its own unique character and beer styles and Mike explained each one expertly. 3 1/2 hours seem to fly by and we thoroughly enjoyed the whole experience. I would highly recommend Toronto Brewery Tours to all !

reviews.title: Another great trip!
text: This was our second time with Toronto Brewery Tours. First trip was West end and this time we went to the East end. Both times our tour guides were knowledgeable, very fun and showed us a great time. I love that they organically let the group get to know each other, so by the need you’re not all strangers (beer helps!). We really liked being able to try samples of styles we wouldn’t want to order a pint of, especially Sours. The value of this trip is great. A fun thing to do with a friend from out of town too.
